lead_paragraph: Harvey Pitt, a former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, weighs in on David L. Sokol’s sudden resignation from Berkshire Hathaway and the quick criticism of Mr. Sokol’s investments in Lubrizol, a Berkshire target. On CNBC, Mr. Pitt called Mr. Sokol’s actions “terrible” and said his initial assessment was that the investments were not legal. He also criticized what he described as a “public relations campaign” to play down the seriousness of the allegations.
